summary: Completed frontend testing of inline editing feature for PMR Medical Education Platform. All 8 requested features tested: Admin Edit button visibility, inline editing mode with textareas, two save buttons (Save Language Only / Save + Translate All), confirmation dialog for translation, role-based access control (student can't see Edit), read-only content display, language toggle, and floating TOC.
passed_tests: Admin can login and see blue 'Edit' button on disease page header
Clicking 'Edit' enables inline editing mode with 'Editing' badge indicator
Inline edit mode shows editable title input field (data-testid='disease-title-edit')
Inline edit mode shows textarea for each content section (Definition, Epidemiology, etc.)
Edit mode bar shows 'Editing in [Language]' indicator
Admin sees 'Cancel' button to exit edit mode without saving
Admin sees 'Save + Translate All' button in green (data-testid='save-translate-btn')
Clicking 'Save + Translate All' opens confirmation dialog
Confirmation dialog shows warning about overwriting content in other languages
Confirmation dialog has 'Cancel' and 'Yes, Save & Translate' buttons
Student/Viewer user cannot see 'Edit' button on disease page
Student sees read-only content with disease title (data-testid='disease-title')
Content sections display correctly in read-only mode with proper formatting
Bullet points render correctly with blue bullet markers
Language toggle dropdown opens showing English, Português, Español options
Floating Table of Contents (TOC) visible on right side with 'ON THIS PAGE' header
TOC shows all sections: Definition, Epidemiology, Pathophysiology, etc.
critical_code_review_comments: Role-based access control properly implemented - isAdmin check gates Edit button visibility
Inline editing state management uses useState hooks correctly (editMode, editedFields, saving, translating)
Save buttons correctly disabled during saving/translating operations
Confirmation dialog properly warns about overwriting translated content
TOC navigation uses scroll-into-view behavior with smooth scrolling
Language toggle persists selection and updates content display
context_for_next_testing_agent: All inline editing features working correctly. Key data-testids for future tests: edit-mode-btn, disease-title-edit, save-single-lang-btn, save-translate-btn, edit-{section_id} for textareas. Language toggle in header uses flag icons (EN/PT/ES). TOC appears on xl screens only (hidden xl:block). Confirmation dialog is modal with AlertTriangle icon.
